issue.subject: merge the overview paper in
issue.description: want just one doc

issue.subject: generate the spec doc, outputting HTML and PDF (latex).
friend of friends should fetch the remote pub signing key
issue.description: Have the recipient fetch instead of the sender deliver. The recipient may not care. It can also be proactive in verifying the message, instead of just waiting.

issue.subject: friend of friends should fetch the remote pub signing key
issue.description: Have the recipient fetch instead of the sender deliver. The recipient may not care. It can also be proactive in verifying the message, instead of just waiting.

issue.subject: config selection should be data driven, code moved out of config file
issue.description: The config file is an ugly mess of code and data. Should be changed to be just data, with a code file (distributed) that does the selection.

issue.subject: remove duplicates from the activity stream
issue.description: Probably just insert the message id, add a unique key constraint on it and make the row insert an insert ignore.

issue.subject: The rb_key table will grow endlessly
issue.description: This needs to be restricted. Probably just a unique key on the table and then using an INSERT IGNORE.

issue.subject: photo links should take the user to the display page.
improve photo tagging
command interface for user management
issue.description: Will need to SU to www, but we shouldn't just rely on the user having WWW privs (the whole web server has this after all).

issue.subject: fix the photo page
user id still requires trailing /
take new user out of the procotol, lift that to a set of management commands
issue.description: Does not belong in the protocol, instead reserve as a command to be issued on the system, as root.

issue.subject: merge site and host sections
bring spec up to current protocol in DSNPd
issue.description: Most of the development on this version is described in the DSNPd project. Need to make the spec current.

issue.subject: implement photo tagging as an example of remote broadcast with subject
DSNPd is getting stricter about use of IDURI
issue.description: Now only accepts proper IDURIs (scheme is dsnp).

issue.subject: daemon needs to be stricter, accept only proper IDURIs
issue.description: The iduri has dsnp as the scheme. All parsers should recognize only this, not https or http.

issue.subject: remove traces of site and username ... now should have just iduris
issue.description: There are still artifacts of the the old assumed iduri composition. Remove them.

issue.subject: use ABNF for specifcation
eliminate the constant forking for queue running, be smarter about it
send notification all on stdin, no args, expect result
need a relid to give to friends to use in FOF messages
issue.description: The relid will be used to decrypt. Then inside will be the signer's iduri.

issue.subject: need to tighten up fof messages, too much revealed
issue.description: There is too much revealed in these message. Need to tighten them up.

issue.subject: must include the full path (starting at host) for remote content
issue.description: Previously we could rely on the username and site forming the base to these paths. No longer true. We don't know how the URI is constructed. The paths for remote items should be full. They should be rooted at the remote host or contain the host. If they contain the host then we allow references to objects at other hosts ... is that a good idea ... possibly for content servers.

issue.subject: one config file with specific vars taken per agent/server
delayed broadcast message delivery if missing repub key
issue.description: If one of the actor's remote broadcast key isn't present, then delay processing of the message.

issue.subject: specify the dsnp functions using a URI arg, not path components
issue.description: We don't want a dependence on any kind of content manager implementation. Using URI args is as generic as we can get. They can be tacked on to any URI.

issue.subject: notifications and commands up to date (USER -> IDURI)
issue.description: In the latest DSNPd version the daemon will no longer know about users, only iduri. The commands and the notifications will change. Need to keep the user agent up date WRT these changes.

issue.subject: don't specify user within iduri
issue.description: This change is motivated by a desire to reduce the requirements placed on content managers. We don't want them to have to adopt our SITE/USER/ iduri conventions. They should be able encode a user id in their iduri however they please.

issue.subject: the notification agent will need a database to manage the site callbacks
issue.description: Need this because we don't want the dsnpd telling the notification agent which program to call.

issue.subject: config file needs main section plus hosts and sites
issue.description: Instead use a main section and host and site sections.

issue.subject: single database for all sites
issue.description: Going to eliminate the specification of the site at connection time. Selecting a database will have to be done using relids, request ids, iduiris, and other things. May move to this method in the future, but that is not something we need at this time.

issue.subject: binary for anything that isn't for communcation with the content manager
use less valuable keys for remote activity
issue.description: Messages should never be signed with the permanent keys. Must arrange for temporary keys. For remote activity we need to know the broadcaster's recipient list (friends in the same network) so we can send them all (tailored) proof of the signing key.

issue.subject: unify the response parsers
issue.description: There are far too many of these and they generally all do the same thing.

issue.subject: TlsConnect should close connections when done.
move away from the term 'user-agent'
issue.description:
Don't try to change the meaning of this from what is extablished.
"Content-Mangaer" would be better.
The reference content manager can be called DCM1 or DCMONE (DSNP Content-Manager One).

issue.subject: signing key pairs for every friendship
signing key pairs for every generation of every network
issue.description: Signed with the friendship signing key, not the identity key. Gives away attacker who has disclosed the sig.

issue.subject: generalize the authorization step for author to all remote broadcast actors
issue.description: Generalize the authorization step for author to all remote broadcast actors, including the publisher.

issue.subject: generalize the authorization step for author to all remote broadcast actors
issue.description: Generalize the authorization step for author to all remote broadcast actors, including the publisher.

issue.subject: notify remote message participants on remote broadcast success
issue.description: It is on this notification we need to record (with subjects it can be failed) Also need to broadcast out of author and subjects.

issue.subject: notify remote message participants on remote broadcast success
issue.description: It is on this notification we need to record (with subjects it can be failed) Also need to broadcast out of author and subjects.

issue.subject: add subjects to remote broadcasting
issue.description: This is necessary to cover tagging and other kinds of messages where a third party needs to be mentioned.

issue.subject: add subjects to remote broadcasting
issue.description: This is necessary to cover tagging and other kinds of messages where a third party needs to be mentioned.

issue.subject: add subjects to remote broadcasting
issue.description: This is necessary to cover tagging and other kinds of messages where a third party needs to be mentioned.

issue.subject: inner sigs in the remote broadcast should be protected by the publisher's broadcast key
issue.description: The inner sig is no longer protected using an inner (author) broadcast key. It is a bad idea to send a sig without any added key. Use the publisher's bk key, which the author has because she is a friend.

issue.subject: protect inner sigs in remote broadcast using the publisher's broadcast key
issue.description: We are no longer encrypting the inner (#212), but the sig needs some protection. Makes sense to use the publisher's broadcast key, so all sigs on the message are verified using the same broadcast key.

issue.subject: don't encrypt in inner remote broadcast
issue.description: As per #212 we are no longer encrypting inner messages in remote broadcast. Since the publisher may display to all friends, we just match that.

issue.subject: remote_inner can go away
issue.description: This does not carry any information now. It can be removed.

issue.subject: remote_inner can go away
issue.description: This does not carry any information now. It can be removed.

issue.subject: use an integer for publication type
in remote activity what we call subject_id is actually publisher_id
in remote activity what we call subject_id is actually publisher_id
record publications in a separate table
issue.description: Use this table to track message identifiers.

issue.subject: the date and time fields should be moved into user messages
the date and time fields should be moved into user messages
the date and time fields should be moved into user messages
sequence numbers should be replaced by a message ID that is allocated by the publisher
issue.description: The message ID should not necessarily by required to be sequential. Up to the publisher?

issue.subject: sequence numbers should be replaced by a message ID that is allocated by the publisher
issue.description: The message ID should not necessarily by required to be sequential. Up to the publisher?

issue.subject: sequence numbers should be replaced by a message ID that is allocated by the publisher
issue.description: The message ID should not necessarily by required to be sequential. Up to the publisher?

issue.subject: is there any point in authors or subjects encrypting messages?
issue.description: The publisher will most likely display the activity on their page. It is not possible for the publisher to serve it only to the author's or the subject's friends, therefore during distribution there is not much point in encrypting using these user's keys. Though signing is certainly advisable.

issue.subject: be precise in our use of IDURI and IDURL
issue.description: IDURI starts with dsnp:// IDURL starts with https://

issue.subject: include in message author/publisher/subject
issue.description: The user messages, which are what are signed, need to have the author, publisher and subject IDURIs in them.

issue.subject: look into the use of error identifiers instead of codes in ERROR returns statements.
issue.description: Eliminating the need for a code -> ID mapping may prove better for the UI implementations.

issue.subject: notification commands should be normalized
issue.description: Many of them have the prefix notification_. This is too verbose.

issue.subject: notification commands should be normalized
issue.description: Many of them have the prefix notification_. This is too verbose.

issue.subject: notification commands should be normalized
issue.description: Many of them have the prefix notification_. This is too verbose.

issue.subject: need to source the comm key from DSNPd in new-site
issue.description: Can't generate this. Responsibility lies with the DSNPd software to generate the key that it requires for communication.

issue.subject: how to configure the call to the notification
issue.description: # Package configure time, in which case one DSNPd can serve only a single kind of user agent. Idea being it is more secure and simpler. # Software configuration time. Not really less secure since conf files are now owned by root and not writable by the network-facing processes. Will allow multiple types of user agents to run on a single host -- perhaps should override all other concerns.

issue.subject: remove dsnpd and associated components
remove the user agent
add configure and runtime checks that the various users exist
must write a pidfile
need an init.d script
listener runs as root, drops privs on new connections
issue.description: This will solve our logfile reopen issue.

issue.subject: conf files owned by root, drop privs after reading them
issue.description: this can prevent the processes from being able to modify the conf files

issue.subject: add log file reopen for rotation
use the three separate log files if backgrounded, otherwise stderr
issue.description: bout time to do this

issue.subject: new request ids for the friend-accept
issue.description: New request ids are warranted here.

issue.subject: new request ids for the friend-accept
issue.description: Can't use relids, shouldn't use the original reqids due to the possible time between request and response. Need something new.

issue.subject: remove relids from friend request and friend accept portions of protocol
issue.description: Now that the number of relids is growing, it it clear they should not be used to identify objects. The reqids should be used. These live only through the friend request process. Possibly another set of semi-nonces.

issue.subject: don't pass any relids to the user agent
issue.description: Don't pass any relids to the user agent. It is not necessary.

issue.subject: expand the friend_claim states to accomodate friend accept
issue.description: Need another friend_claim state for friend accept state. The sender moves into ACCEPT_GRANTED in the notify_accept, then goes into ESTABLISHED on the registered.

issue.subject: consider using two ports, messages and control
issue.description: The message port for high volume broadcast. Control for user-user interaction.

issue.subject: sent and received friend requests should go into the friend claim table
issue.description: Sent and received friend requests should go into the friend claim table. We should use a state to distinguish them. This will allow for streamlined handling of prefriend and friend messages, which is getting quite complicated with the various privilege levels.

issue.subject: public key expiry and extension
issue.description:
possible
will allow reclaiming of iduri if no keepalive is issued
"Must never change" is too permanent.

issue.subject: add encryption packets for relid set and relid set pair
issue.description: # Packet for a set of four relids. # Packet for a pair of relid sets.

issue.subject: encryption packets for relids
issue.description: There should be one that encapsulates the four relids, one per key. There should be another that encapsulates two pairs of relid sets, for the friend-request process to use.

issue.subject: make encryption packets binary
issue.description: see related issue

issue.subject: encryption packets should be fully binary
issue.description: Many encryption packets are composed of other encryption packets, resulting in binary data. Makes sense to go all binary and not bother with ascii at all. Also, encryption packets don't need to be parsed or composed in the UI (typically scripting languages).

issue.subject: eliminate the prefriend message
issue.description: With the advent of the four keys we don't want to have to make explicit the type of message (key priv) of each message, so we will allocate multiple relids. In keeping with this hiding, we should also hide the fact that a message is a prefriend message. Merge these messages into 'message.'

issue.subject: eliminate the prefriend message
issue.description: With the advent of the four keys we don't want to have to make explicit the type of message (key priv) of each message, so we will allocate multiple relids. In keeping with this hiding, we should also hide the fact that a message is a prefriend message. Merge these messages into 'message' and select the resulting parser based on the state of the relationship.

issue.subject: public key packet needs to be updated to include the four keys, plus a priv0 sig.
cleans strings on free, use location to fill
clear login tokens on startup
login token management needs to happen in the key agent
issue.description: Need to tie active tokens to unlocked private keys in the key agent

issue.subject: need encryption packet for password-encrypted data
the key agent should not rely on the user -> id and iduri -> id mappings in DSNPd
issue.description: The key agent should store user names and iduris. Altering DSNPd user ids to another user's set of keys is a possible attack vectors. Keys should be fixed to the string identifying the owner (the public facing identifier).

issue.subject: create and manage keys on multiple priv levels
issue.description: Start creating the four keys, manage and use them.

issue.subject: move password storage into the key agent
issue.description: that's where it belongs

issue.subject: new user creation should pause until the notification comes in
issue.description: otherwise it appears as no new user was created

issue.subject: separate tables for get and put relids
CA cert file should be set at configuration time
issue.description: Add a configuration option and some guessing for the CA cert file. This will eliminate the new-site config file entirely.

issue.subject: key agent must use a separate config file
issue.description: otherwise database creds are available to DSNPd.

issue.subject: the public_keys table in DSNPd should just record that the key has been fetched
broadcast keys need to go into the key agent
encrypt in the key agent
issue.description: first step to jailing keys: signEncrypt in the key agent.

issue.subject: new-user data directory creation needs to happen in the notification half
issue.description: belongs in the user agent, no permissions in dsnpd anyways.

issue.subject: allocate private keys in the key agent
issue.description: Will have to return them to DSNPd as a temporary means of keeping DSNPd working until encryption happpens in the agent.

issue.subject: public keys that come from elsewhere need to be stored in the key agent
issue.description: Need a database connection and to store incoming keys.

issue.subject: eliminate the config global
issue.description: Won't do for setting configuration of the keyagent, which needs to be a thread.

issue.subject: cleanup the communcation with the notification service
issue.description: Quite a nasty mess there. Need some abstraction.

issue.subject: add an option to background
issue.description: Can currently run DSNPd only in foreground mode, with logging going to stderr.

issue.subject: reap child processes (servers)
issue.description: The listen fork-loop needs to reap child processes. These are currently left as zombies.

issue.subject: implement a queue runner off the listen-fork loop
issue.description: The queue runner used to run at the end of a server run, after it's connection was closed. It can now be hung off the listen-fork loop.

issue.subject: open TLS context before forking
issue.description: Now that we are doing the listen-fork ourselves we can open TLS context sooner and avoid doing it at every server startup.

issue.subject: add a notification process for executing the UA notification
add a key agent process for jailing private keys and operations on them
implement a listener process and fork server processes on incoming connections
issue.description: A few reasons to go this way now ... 1. Don't want to load TLS context on every connection 2. Want a privileged process for black boxing private keys and managing sessions. Access should be granted to this process via a pipe passed on by the fork. 3. Want to trigger operations by a timer.

issue.subject: log file should indicate which site log message concerns
login failure delay
issue.description: security essential

issue.subject: partition server commands by local/TLS connection
issue.description: Once a connection has been established as local or TLS, jump to a parser with only the appropriate commands. This will result in parse errors if local commands are issued on a non-local connection and vice versa.

issue.subject: local connections must be verified as on the loopback interface
parse messages as they are submitted
issue.description: When messages come in via submit_broadcast and other, the message body should be verified then.

issue.subject: describe the user message format
need new notifications to support database split
issue.description: Once DSNPd and UA start using separate databases there will need to be a number of new notifications.

issue.subject: separate databases of DSNPd and user-agent
issue.description: It is time to bring the split between the DSNPd and user-agent databases back. The complexity is now justified. This split is essential if DSNPd is to be considered reusable.

issue.subject: follow protocol spec in passing in login tokens where login is required
issue.description: A number of commands are only for logged-in users. The DSNP 0.3 spec will require that login tokens be used for these commands. Need to follow the spec.

issue.subject: friend request referral to bypass captcha
issue.description: If you are a friend of a friend you should be able to friend request without having to solve a captcha.

issue.subject: friend of a friend login
issue.description: should result in a new role type

issue.subject: means to go home to verify arbitrary content
issue.description: This should be independent of the content type.

issue.subject: do we want https:// included in the IDURI?
issue.description: needs to be resolved.

issue.subject: add a notification for logging out the user from the user-agent
need to track session id in the login tables
supply session id at login time
issue.description:
Need to supply a user-agent chosen session id to supply at login time. The session id will be used by the daemon to notify the user agent when login tokens are no longer valid.
This should be done for user login and friend login.

issue.subject: encryption routines must throw errors
issue.description: they are currently returning values that re ignored

issue.subject: need to describe errors
issue.description: Need to describe errors, including arguments. This should include the mechanism that DSNPd uses to communicate with user agents, as well as with other servers.

issue.subject: need a notification for DSNPd to use to expire cookies
issue.description: The lifetime of a login cookie needs to be controlled by DSNPd, since it can receive logout requests from other servers. DSNPd needs to be able to notify that a cookie is done.

issue.subject: need to parse message payloads before handing them to the notification script
issue.description: the notification program will parse them, but we should verify them inside dsnp first

issue.subject: need to describe notifications
issue.description: notifications are formalized, we need to describe them.

issue.subject: return payloads should use standard format (length-body)
issue.description: In many cases there are blocks returned that are stuffed into a single token. These should go into length-body format.

issue.subject: parsers and constructors for encryption packets
issue.description: In the process of specifying these. Implementation should be done in parallel.

issue.subject: formalize encryption packet
issue.description: Encryption data packets are parsed and reconstructed without any kind of specification. They should be specified in a manner that is consistent with the rest of the protocol.

issue.subject: four private keys should be allocated per user
issue.description: * priv 3: no password. For activity that doesn't require the user be logged in. * priv 2: password, decrypted in memory only while user is logged in. A sig indicates the user is currently logged in. Used for activity by logged in user. * priv 1: password, never stored in memory, decrypted on each login. A sig by this key indicates the user recently logged in with her password. * priv 0: password, never stored in memory, decrypted on demand. A sig by the key indicates the user submitted her password to produce the sig. This ring is reserved for moving and deleting the identity.

issue.subject: query the sysadmin for convert program in init-system
issue.description: Install it in the new-site-conf file and source that when making configuration files.

issue.subject: new user page needs a hint for valid user names
there is no non-blocking SSL connect
issue.description: needed for consistency

issue.subject: nonblocking SSL accept needs work
limit the token collection buffer across all parsers
issue.description: security essential

issue.subject: add a dsnp user
issue.description: The daemon should run as an isolated user.

issue.subject: need to remove the redirect to a login page when taken home and have no creds
issue.description: This usage pattern encourages phishing. It should not be used.

issue.subject: display of browser's activity cannot send to friend login
issue.description:
Causes relationship not found error. Should instead just go to the root of identity.
Reported by Wren.

issue.subject: need to catch exceptions in the queue runner
issue.description: Need to catch exceptions in the queue runner. However we cannot print error messages to any BIO, we should just log. This will require some adjustment to the error handling framework.

issue.subject: disable or fix image uploading
issue.description: it is broken in the currently deployed release

issue.subject: make spec document more easily available (not inside a tarball)
simplify negotiation to just one exchange
issue.description: To reduce exchanges, send magic number, supported versions, site and auth in first command server chooses a version, selects the site and moves into auth mode all at once.

issue.subject: protocol+version, comm_key commands need results
links in message board need login hashes
issue.description: They can't be used to initially login to a friend's page.

issue.subject: redirecting from /cred/login back to the home page is annoying
issue.description: breaks the back button after a login.

issue.subject: "arg does not validate" is way too cryptic
issue.description: Need friendlier, custom error messages for each arg.

issue.subject: lowercase user names too restrictive
issue.description: At least need uppercase and some symbols like '.'.

issue.subject: dsnpd: switch to non-blocking sockets with select
issue.description: This will allow timeout to be properly implemented.

issue.subject: timeouts on writes in UI and backend
issue.description: Have some read timeouts, need write timeouts as well.

issue.subject: schema refactor around users, identities, relationships
issue.description: Breaking down the schema.

issue.subject: need to organize names for different types of things
issue.description: id -> column name for primary key iduri -> the URI representing a user's identity user -> the username

issue.subject: friend_claim table has friend_id and identity columns
issue.description: Duplicate found it's way in during early development. Need just one.

issue.subject: all activity should have both subject and author
add check for exepected schema version to daemon and user agent
issue.description: Refuse to run if the schema is not the correct version.

issue.subject: extend friend_claim table to include self
issue.description: Move friend_claim towards a 'relationship' table with all possible kinds of relationships that could occur in an activity stream, oneself.

issue.subject: salt in friend_id table probably is not needed
issue.description: likely don't need this

issue.subject: switch away from RC4 or abandon prefix
issue.description: RC4 weak WRT prefix. Harden this or pick something else. Very well known bug.

issue.subject: key data out of user table
issue.description: Key data needs to come out of the user table and into a separate table that the _ua user does not have access to.

issue.subject: id hash computation should use lowercase ID
issue.description: Much of the system allows case-insensitive identities. The friend-hash computation needs to follow. If changed, the DB needs to be updated throughout.

issue.subject: reduce concurrent connection consumption
issue.description: concurrent connection consumption is pretty high during message propgation. Need some turn takgin.

issue.subject: logout should force logout with friends
issue.description: otherwise a trail of logins is left about for other people using the browser to stumble upon

issue.subject: users can set their names to empty, to create zero-length links
issue.description: should detect empty names and use the user name instead

issue.subject: stop using relid in get_tree, use another nonce instead
issue.description: No need to use relid, pick something else instead.

issue.subject: ping up the tree
issue.description: An ack of all messages up the tree is pretty complicated. Maybe just periodic pings. The ping could contain the max of all highest message sequence number.

issue.subject: can't use case-insensitive searches in mysql for base64 data
error messages are a little too intense
issue.description: Need to tone them down a bit. Less red.

issue.subject: need a testing page to verify that an installation is set up
issue.description: There are a lot of details to take care of

issue.subject: need a way to evaluate someone who has friend-requested you
implement the friend request ababndon
need better random data
issue.description: need to generate the good stuff, save it on shutdown and load on startup

issue.subject: need to implement the bottom-up distribution tree
issue.description: This will require the addition of a redundancy number to indicate which redundant version of the tree a message is associated with. This should be distinct from the distribution tree identity that is used to categorize friends.

issue.subject: the init.sh script is missing SSL conf info.
issue.description: It should ask about this and set it up.

issue.subject: all connections must either be SSL or from localhost
issue.description: The localhost check should be performed when the connection opens. If over the loopback interface then non-ssl is permitted. Otherwise it is required.

issue.subject: login function should return a token used to auth user-based commands
issue.description: The login function should return a token that is used to authorize user-based commands.

issue.subject: wrapping text of a message around a floated details section is awkward
issue.description: instead just divide the sections with a vertical divider

issue.subject: friend links not complete on testing sites
issue.description:
From Suzanne:
Going on my site and checking my friends'list, I noticed the following:
On your friend list Gomethrius should be common with mine On Gomethrius' list Adrian and Santa should be common with mine On Chris' list Gomethrius, Paul and Soojin should be common to mine.

issue.subject: error in SSL_connect when trying to reload friends for thurston
issue.description: Most likely due to xinet limit on number of connections.

issue.subject: resetting the forward tree for thurston causes an error
issue.description: resetting the forward tree for thurston causes SSL_connect to error

issue.subject: problem with friend login Grandpa -> Gomethrius
issue.description: need to investigate this

issue.subject: need a retry time on failed messages
forward_tree_insert after a ftr segfaults
issue.description: may not be building tree correctly

issue.subject: need to prevent friending oneself in DSNPd.
issue.description: The frontent prevents this. The daemon should also prevent it.

issue.subject: if the notification log file cannot be opened, the message is lost
issue.description: should just redirect to /dev/null

issue.subject: photo uploads in the activity stream link to the thumbnail, should link to full
there seems to be duplicates on the test site
issue.description: could be due to message sending failures -- good messages seem to get duplicated due to the presence of the failures

issue.subject: bad crash on wrong password
issue.description:
Notice (8): Undefined variable: code [/var/www/dsnp-devel/cake_1.2.5/cake/libs/error.php, line 130]

Code | Context

$params =       array(
        "USER_ID" => "9",
        "USER_NAME" => "Suzanne",
        "USER_URI" => "https://www.anemonal.ca/Suzanne/",
        "USER" => array(
        "id" => "9",
        "user" => "Suzanne",
        "identity" => "https://www.anemonal.ca/Suzanne/",
        "name" => "Suzanne Thurston",
        "email" => null,
        "display_short" => "Suzanne",
        "display_long" => "https://www.anemonal.ca/Suzanne/"
)
)

$USER_NAME      =       "Suzanne"
$USER_URI       =       "https://www.anemonal.ca/Suzanne/"
$USER   =       array(
        "id" => "9",
        "user" => "Suzanne",
        "identity" => "https://www.anemonal.ca/Suzanne/",
        "name" => "Suzanne Thurston",
        "email" => null,
        "display_short" => "Suzanne",
        "display_long" => "https://www.anemonal.ca/Suzanne/"
)

        extract($params, EXTR_OVERWRITE);
        $this->controller->set(array(
            'code' => $code,

Object::dispatchMethod() - /var/www/dsnp-devel/cake_1.2.5/cake/libs/object.php, line 118

AppError::__construct() - APP/app_error.php, line 14
Object::cakeError() - /var/www/dsnp-devel/cake_1.2.5/cake/libs/object.php, line 201
AppController::userError() - APP/app_controller.php, line 62
CredController::slogin() - APP/controllers/cred_controller.php, line 43

issue.subject: the init.sh script should allow sites to be added to the roster.
local delivery mechanism
issue.description: Need a mechanism, probably a program specified in the conf file, that is used to notify on events and deliver messages from DSNPd to the application.

issue.subject: remove user-data from backend user table
issue.description: Need to move to a strict separation of DSNP tables from user-data. All user data is stored by the application and the DSNPd manages only the user data necessary for connection.
